intro: Echium setosum, commonly known as the hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echium setosum is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
